regulations.title: Standards of Performance for Crude Oil and Natural Gas Production, Transmission, and Distribution
regulations.description: NSPS OOOO establishes emission standards for volatile organic compounds (VOC) from equipment and operations in the oil and gas sector that commenced construction, modification, or reconstruction after August 23, 2011.
key_requirements: 95% VOC control for storage vessels with PTE ≥6 tpy
Reduced emission completions for hydraulically fractured wells
Low-bleed or no-bleed pneumatic controllers
Capture and control of compressor emissions
monitoring_requirements: Initial and periodic monitoring of control devices
Pneumatic controller counts and bleed rates
reporting_requirements: Initial notification within 180 days of startup

regulations.title: Standards of Performance for Crude Oil and Natural Gas Facilities for which Construction, Modification or Reconstruction Commenced After September 18, 2015
regulations.description: NSPS OOOOa extends and strengthens the requirements of NSPS OOOO, adding methane emission standards and fugitive emissions monitoring requirements for well sites and compressor stations.
key_requirements: Fugitive emissions monitoring using OGI or Method 21
Semiannual surveys for well sites, quarterly for compressor stations
Repair leaks within 30 days of detection
Pneumatic pump standards
Centrifugal compressor wet seal degassing system requirements
monitoring_requirements: OGI camera surveys or EPA Method 21
recordkeeping_requirements: Fugitive monitoring records including date, findings, and repairs
Digital photographs or video of surveys

regulations.title: Standards of Performance for Crude Oil and Natural Gas Facilities: Review
regulations.description: NSPS OOOOb updates and strengthens oil and gas emission standards, expanding fugitive monitoring requirements and adding super-emitter response programs.
key_requirements: Quarterly OGI monitoring for all sites
Zero-emission pneumatic controllers for new sources
Super-emitter response program participation
Wellhead-only well site exemption removed
Associated gas capture requirements
monitoring_requirements: Quarterly OGI surveys for all affected facilities
Advanced monitoring through certified third parties

regulations.title: National Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants from Oil and Natural Gas Production Facilities
regulations.description: NESHAP HH establishes emission standards for hazardous air pollutants (HAP) from major sources in oil and natural gas production, including glycol dehydrators and storage vessels.

applicability_thresholds.major_source_hap: 10 tpy single HAP or 25 tpy combined HAPs

key_requirements: 95% HAP control for glycol dehydrators with BTEX emissions ≥1 tpy
Storage vessel HAP control requirements
Equipment leak standards for major sources
monitoring_requirements: Continuous parameter monitoring for control devices

regulations.title: Petroleum and Natural Gas Systems
regulations.description: Subpart W of the Greenhouse Gas Reporting Program requires petroleum and natural gas facilities to report annual GHG emissions to EPA.
key_requirements: Annual GHG emissions calculation and reporting
Source-level emissions quantification
Methodology selection per source category
Third-party verification for large emitters
monitoring_requirements: Equipment counts by emission source category
Emission factor application or direct measurement
reporting_requirements: Annual report due March 31 via e-GGRT

regulations.title: Oil and Gas Facilities (Texas)
regulations.description: Texas permit by rule for oil and gas production facilities, providing standard authorization for common equipment.
key_requirements: Emission limits for VOC, NOx, CO, SO2
Best management practices for tanks
Distance limitations from property lines
Flare requirements
